definition: fart/flatulence/nonsense/(usu. in the negative) what/(not) a damn thing
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Or it was just poetic bullshit?
sentences.chinese: 還是說，這只是一句聽上去像詩的屁話？

sentences.english: Do you guys really believe this shit?
sentences.chinese: 你們真的相信這種屁話？

sentences.english: The meeting of the tourist industry, the research on tourist guides' code of ethics , all these are pure bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 香港旅遊業開甚麼會，甚麼研究導遊操守，都是屁話。

sentences.english: But all of that is just marketing bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 但所有這些都只是營銷的屁話。

definition: angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
